p: The impact of hypertension on health continues to rise despite the advances in antihypertensive drug development by the pharmaceutical industry. In 2018, data from the American Heart Association indicated that 40.6% of deaths from cardiovascular disease in the U.S. were related to hypertension [ 1] and in the year 2035 the costs related to hypertension will exceed 220 billion dollars. Hypertension is a pandemic disease that affects approximately one-third of the world population [ 2].
